meanings.definition: To remove something from a box.
meanings.sent1: She unboxes the new toy carefully.
meanings.sent2: Every Christmas, he unboxes his presents with excitement.
meanings.sent3: The cat unboxes the treats and makes a mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: As she unboxes her memories, she feels a sense of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: He unboxes the surprise gift, revealing a beautiful necklace.

meanings.definition: To reveal the contents of a box.
meanings.sent1: He unboxes the mystery package to see what's inside.
meanings.sent2: The magician unboxes the trick, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent3: The detective unboxes the evidence, solving the case in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her smile unboxes the joy hidden within her heart.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map unboxes the location of the hidden chest.

meanings.definition: To open a box and take out its contents.
meanings.sent1: Mom unboxes the groceries and starts preparing dinner.
meanings.sent2: He unboxes the package and finds the book he ordered.
meanings.sent3: The robot unboxes the tools, ready to build something amazing.
meanings.sent4: The sun unboxes its rays, brightening up the cloudy sky.
meanings.sent5: She unboxes the memories stored in the old chest, reminiscing about the past.
